properties.media:imagetext:
Tokyo
July 24th 1947
Dear Debby•
How grand it was to see and talk with Harold
yesterday when he came out to lunch with us. He and the
General had met before in the General's office but we
did have a good talk just the three of us and I enjoyed
so hearing about each of you. Harold also saw Arthur too
for a few minutes, Arthur broke his left arm the last of
May ice skating, the cast comes off today so you know how
pleased we are
and grateful that the arm has healed so
nicely).
so much real pleasure and use from your sift as it ist
Thanks so for this lovely white sweater
the weight that I like and the fit,is perfect.
What a wonderful family you have and what the grand
children must mean to you and Harold(what very luchy
grandchildren they are I think with such grand parents)
Life is busy here but really full of much interest
and one of the most delightful things for me always are
the people we have out for lunch. The Trippe party, I
did enjoy, some I knew before.
Harold looks so well and changed so very little all
these years, He and I talked some of course of"S11m"
and
Mrs. Lindbergh(his mother) and I will write her a note
as she will be interested in hearing that I have seen
and talked with Harold. She evidently is not any too
well from what Harold told me and too I gathered that
when I saw Slim in Australia.
I keep up with Manila some from a few of the old ones
who are back but it is still a distressing picture,with
so much destruction. Not the lovely Manila we knew
and
loved. Living is sky high there now too.
Thanks so for the lovely note you sent with the
sweater,you can well understand I know what it means to
me to hear such things said of the General.
Love always to you and yours eau

From
APO
MPO 5Douglas MacA thur
c/o Postmaster San Franciscos
194
500
Mrs. Harold Bixby-
Bolton Landing
New York
